alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Hancock; Hendricks; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 1:01PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hancock, east central Hendricks, Marion and southwestern Hamilton Counties through 130 PM EST... At 100 PM EST, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Speedway, or 8 miles west of Indianapolis, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carmel, Fishers and Noblesville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 107 and 125. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 208. Interstate 70 between mile markers 70 and 91. Interstate 74 between mile markers 69 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for central Indiana.
